text: [Music]
good afternoon ladies and gentlemen let
us welcome you to the final day of
dramatic battle between great tragedians
it is a spring day here in ancient
Greece nearly 17,000 patrons are filing
in to the theater of dionis to watch top
playwrights including favorites escalus
and Sophocles duke it out to see whose
hero may be deemed most tragic whose
story most awful well see christoplos in
last week's Battle of the choruses all
50 members of each playwright's chorus
traveled back and forth across the stage
singing the strophy and antistrophe
telling misbegotten Tales of Woe today's
first chorus is entering through the
paradoy taking their positions in the
orchestra at the bottom of the stage
Mario lokia this is nothing we haven't
seen before all 50 members speaking from
the depths of their souls wait what what
is this I've not seen this before
cristopolis there is one actor stepping
out of coral formation assuming an
independent role in this play can you
make out who it is that looks like thus
it seems he's changing his mask and
taking on the role of another character
Incredible surely thespis will go down
in history as the very first actor he
has changed the face of theater forever
and that was just the war up act on to
the main attraction escalus will have
the stage first let's see what he does
we expect great things last competition
Sophocles beat him by a smidge but
escalus is still considered the father
of tragedy now escalus frequently
competes at this Festival the city
diania though his plays are violent the
Bloodshed is never seen by the audience
which allows the dramatic tension to
take Center Stage let's see what he does
today to try to win his title back here
comes escalus is chorus but they seem to
be missing quite a few people what is
going on here not only are they down a
few people there are two actors taking
Center Stage this is absolutely unheard
of he has built on thesis' idea and
added a second actor to the mix escalus
is relying on the two individuals to
tell the story the dialogue possible in
tragedy now has taken precedence over
the chorus no wonder he drastically
shrunk its size this Applause is well
deserved the crowd has hushed
sophocles's actors and chorus are taking
the stage for the play edus Rex as usual
the chorus is set up in the orchestra
and what's this Sophocles has added a
third actor Will this one upmanship
never end three actors and they are
changing their masks to take on several
different roles as they weave the tale
of edus a nice fellow who kills his
father and marries his mother kills his
father and marries his mother that
sounds pretty tragic to me it is most
tragic Mario lokia call me crazy but I'm
willing to bet that future Generations
will hold this play up as the perfect
example of tragedy excuse me copoulos
edus has left the stage after realizing
jokasta was his wife and also his mother
where has he gone I can't even imagine
wait the messenger has stepped on stage
and is telling us of the great King's
actions he says that edifus upon finding
his mother wife whatever jokasta dead of
her own hand in their incestuous bedroom
took the broches from her dress and
stabbed his eyes repeatedly you can't
blame the guy can you beted his mother
killed his father is father and brother
to his children I might do the same my
friend I do believe we've seen it all
indeed we have there is nothing more
tragic than edus and sure enough the
judges who have been chosen by lot from
all over Greece are ready to announce
the winner oh folks this is one for the
history books dark horse playright filic
has taken first prize what an upset what
a tragedy what a night folks we have
witnessed the laying of the foundation
of modern theater and some great
Innovations the shrinking of the chorus
the addition of three actors and such
catharsis doesn't a great tragedy just
make you feel renewed and cleansed it
sure does but now we are out of time I'm
copos and I'm Mario lokia peace love and
catharsis
